content.webTitle: Picks of the Week: South: Film

fields.headline: Picks of the Week: South: Film
fields.bodyText: The Wave Based on true-life events in late-60s California and heightened a bit for dramatic purposes, this cautionary German teen movie finds fascism being fomented when a controversial school project gathers momentum. Eden Lake Another gory, edge-of-seat onslaught in the charming British countryside, but by pitting urban pleasure-seekers against disaffected local teens, first-timer James Watkins certainly raises some talking points. Jar City A solid police procedural in the classical tradition, as a tough, weary cop opens cans (or rather jars) of worms in a murder hunt, but the epic Icelandic locations add a distinct local flavour. Tropic Thunder It's been fashionable to knock Ben Stiller's big-budget war-movie satire, but when it's funny it's very funny, with a jaw-dropping cameo by a major Hollywood movie star that must be seen to be believed. Hellboy II Making the Dark Knight look like a giant sulking competition, this wildly imaginative movie combines magical special effects with an irresistible sense of humour, not to mention a dash of Barry Manilow.
